api_call: dropbox_client.files_upload(f, path, mode=WriteMode(u'add', None), autorename=False, client_modified=None, mute=False, property_groups=None, strict_conflict=False, content_hash=None)

api_arguments.path: String (The destination path in Dropbox where you want to upload the file)
api_arguments.mode: WriteMode (Optional parameter specifying how to handle conflicts if a file with the same name already exists)
api_arguments.autorename: boolean (Optional parameter specifying whether Dropbox should automatically rename the file if there's a conflict)
api_arguments.client_modified: String (Optional parameter specifying the modification time to set for the uploaded file)
api_arguments.mute: boolean (Optional parameter specifying whether to suppress notifications about the upload)
api_arguments.property_groups: Array (Optional parameter specifying additional file properties to set)
api_arguments.strict_conflict: boolean (Optional parameter specifying whether to raise an error if there's a conflict)
api_arguments.content_hash: String (Optional parameter specifying the content hash of the file for conflict resolution)

functionality: Upload a file to Dropbox using files_upload function
example_code:
import dropbox

# Access token for Dropbox
ACCESS_TOKEN = 'your_access_token'
dropbox_client = dropbox.Dropbox(ACCESS_TOKEN)

# Path to the local file
local_file_path = '/path/to/local/file.txt'

# Destination path in Dropbox
dropbox_file_path = '/path/to/dropbox/file.txt'

# Read the file contents
with open(local_file_path, 'rb') as f:
    # Upload the file to Dropbox
    dropbox_client.files_upload(f.read(), dropbox_file_path)
Questions: How can I upload files to Dropbox using Python and the Dropbox API?
What are the parameters of the files_upload function in the Dropbox Python SDK?
